newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: Eldorado plans Australian float - Gencor.
newsitem.headline: Eldorado plans Australian float - Gencor.

text.p: South African mining group Gencor Ltd said on Wednesday that its 42 percent-owned Eldorado Gold Corp Inc planned to list its ordinary shares on the Australian Stock Exchange in early calendar 1997.
"(The listing) puts more quality into the security of the portfolio (of Eldorado)," Gencor executive director Gregory Maude told Reuters at a resources conference.
The listing would involve capital raising, he said.
Maude did not know the intended size or structure of the float but said funds raised were likely to be used for acquisitions in Australia.

"I imagine early on it would be to deal with Australian acquisitions to get more confidence in the Eldorado name as an international operator and then it would look to raise futher funds for offshore things," he said.
Maude said Eldorado, which holds 19.6 percent of Australia's Croesus Mining NlL, had focussed its exploration attention on the Northern Territory.

Gencor took its stake in Eldorado in January by giving the Canadian miner one producing mine, exploration acreage and the North American rights to use and sub-licence Gencor's Biox bacterial oxidation technology.
Croesus shares closed unchanged at A$0.83.
